did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art Photography Department records

bioghist.p: Charles Whitenack was hired as the first staff photographer in 1920, and remained until 1956 when he was succeeded by Alfred J. Wyatt. Wyatt was photographer until leaving in 1976. Under these two photographers, the Department of Photography grew and performed such functions as photographing the collections and making photographs for Museum and outside publications.

scopecontent.p: This small record group related to the Photography Department contains records of Charles Whitenack and Alfred J. Wyatt. Materials include: general correspondence of Charles Whitenack (1930-1937); drafts of proposals for equipment and space changes to the Photography Department for the 1969 Centennial report; photograph price lists, 1940-1974; sampling of requests for photographs (1924-1940); space studies, 1963-1967; and a manuscript of "Photography at PMA" by A.J. Wyatt written in 1963-1964 for publication in the National Professional Photographer.
